QC.Acc01.description: Is the source code managed with a Version Control System?
QC.Acc01.hint: The source code shall be managed with Git and remain publicly available for this criterion to be successful. Please check Pro Git docs about how to get started using Git tool. Guidelines provided by the most popular social coding platforms (GitHub, GitLab) are also a good starting point

evidence.message: Source code uses Git for version control

standard.title: A set of Common Software Quality Assurance Baseline Criteria for Research Projects

QC.Doc06.1.description: Is the software scope outlined in the code repository?
QC.Doc06.1.hint: A README file presents your software to the audience interested in your software project. Several online sites simplify the task of creating the README file, such as Make a README or readme.so sites. Be sure to add it to the code repository's root path

evidence.message: A README file is present in the code repository

standard.title: A set of Common Software Quality Assurance Baseline Criteria for Research Projects

QC.Doc06.3.description: Does the project establish a code of conduct for its participants?
QC.Doc06.3.hint: A CODE_OF_CONDUCT file sets the path for a constructive, respectful and positive atmosphere among all the contributors in your software project. Of course you can define your own, but in case you want to rely on external and widely-adopted code of conducts check out some of the most popular ones: Contributor Covenant or Citizen Code of Conduct

evidence.message: A CODE_OF_CONDUCT file is not present in the code repository

standard.title: A set of Common Software Quality Assurance Baseline Criteria for Research Projects

QC.Doc06.2.description: Is there a clear path or guidelines on how to contribute to the code?
QC.Doc06.2.hint: A CONTRIBUTING file shall be present in the root path of the code repository describing the expected workflow to follow when adding contributions. Please check Mozilla's guidelines and GitHub's CONTRIBUTING.md example to get inspired on how to write a good CONTRIBUTING file

evidence.message: A CONTRIBUTING file is not present in the code repository

standard.title: A set of Common Software Quality Assurance Baseline Criteria for Research Projects

QC.Doc01.1.description: Are docs managed in the same repository as code?
QC.Doc01.1.hint: This subcriterion will succeed if the documentation files exist on the same repository as the source code, e.g. under a docs/ folder

evidence.message: Documentation resides in the same repository as code

standard.title: A set of Common Software Quality Assurance Baseline Criteria for Research Projects

QC.Doc02.X.description: Are docs following a style for the Markdown markup language?
QC.Doc02.X.hint: When using a docs-as-code approach, the style of the markup language is being checked. SQAaaS relies on markdownlint for Markdown files and restructuredtext-lint for reStructuredText

evidence.message: Docs are not fully compliant with markdownlint standard

ci.name: QC.Doc github.com/OSTrails/FDP-Index-Proxy markdownlint
ci.stdout_text: [{"filename":"./README.md","line":1,"rule":"MD022","aliases":["blanks-around-headers"],"description":"Headers should be surrounded by blank lines"},{"filename":"./fdp_index_proxy/README.md","line":5,"rule":"MD013","aliases":["line-length"],"description":"Line length"},{"filename":"./fdp_index_proxy/README.md","line":9,"rule":"MD013","aliases":["line-length"],"description":"Line length"},{"filename":"./fdp_index_proxy/README.md","line":25,"rule":"MD013","aliases":["line-length"],"description":"Line length"},{"filename":"./fdp_index_proxy/README.md","line":27,"rule":"MD013","aliases":["line-length"],"description":"Line length"},{"filename":"./fdp_index_proxy/README.md","line":13,"rule":"MD014","aliases":["commands-show-output"],"description":"Dollar signs used before commands without showing output"},{"filename":"./fdp_index_proxy/README.md","line":17,"rule":"MD014","aliases":["commands-show-output"],"description":"Dollar signs used before commands without showing output"},{"filename":"./fdp_index_proxy/README.md","line":31,"rule":"MD034","aliases":["no-bare-urls"],"description":"Bare URL used"},{"filename":"./fdp_index_proxy/README.md","line":13,"rule":"MD046","aliases":["code-block-style"],"description":"Code block style"},{"filename":"./fdp_index_proxy/README.md","line":17,"rule":"MD046","aliases":["code-block-style"],"description":"Code block style"}]

standard.title: A set of Common Software Quality Assurance Baseline Criteria for Research Projects

MD022.description: Headers should be surrounded by blank lines

MD014.description: Dollar signs used before commands without showing output

QC.Lic01.description: Is code licensed to be freely used, modified and distributed by others?
QC.Lic01.hint:
Your source code repository shall be distributed under an open source license for this subcriterion to pass successfully. Be sure to have a license file present in the code repository matching the name LICENSE with optional extensions (depending on the format used): [.md|.rst|.txt].

Valid licenses are any of those approved either by the Open Source Initiative and/or the Free Software Foundation . You can also check the choosealicense.com site

evidence.message: An Open Source license found in the code repository: MIT

QC.Lic01.1.description: Is LICENSE file placed in the root path of the code repository?
QC.Lic01.1.hint: Most social coding platforms require the license file to placed in the root path of the code repository, so it is a good practice to use this location by default. Allowed file names are LICENSE, LICENSE.md, LICENSE.rst, LICENSE.txt

evidence.message: LICENSE file is visible at the root path of the code repository: LICENSE

standard.title: A set of Common Software Quality Assurance Baseline Criteria for Research Projects

meta.title: MIT License
meta.description: A short and simple permissive license with conditions only requiring preservation of copyright and license notices. Licensed works, modifications, and larger works may be distributed under different terms and without source code.
meta.how: Create a text file (typically named LICENSE or LICENSE.txt) in the root of your source code and copy the text of the license into the file. Replace [year] with the current year and [fullname] with the name (or names) of the copyright holders.

permissions.label: Commercial use
permissions.description: The licensed material and derivatives may be used for commercial purposes.

permissions.label: Modification
permissions.description: The licensed material may be modified.

permissions.label: Distribution
permissions.description: The licensed material may be distributed.

permissions.label: Private use
permissions.description: The licensed material may be used and modified in private.

conditions.label: License and copyright notice
conditions.description: A copy of the license and copyright notice must be included with the licensed material.

limitations.label: Liability
limitations.description: This license includes a limitation of liability.

limitations.label: Warranty
limitations.description: This license explicitly states that it does NOT provide any warranty.

fields.name: fullname
fields.description: The full name or username of the repository owner

QC.Sty01.description: Is the software product following a style standard for Dockerfile files?
QC.Sty01.hint: Please check & solve the security weaknesses found by the linter tool

evidence.message: Dockerfile files are compliant with hadolint standard

ci.name: QC.Sty github.com/OSTrails/FDP-Index-Proxy hadolint
ci.stdout_text:
Dockerfile:7 DL3002 [1m[93mwarning[0m: Last USER should not be root
Dockerfile:8 DL3009 [92minfo[0m: Delete the apt-get lists after installing something
Dockerfile:9 DL3009 [92minfo[0m: Delete the apt-get lists after installing something
Dockerfile:10 DL3008 [1m[93mwarning[0m: Pin versions in apt get install. Instead of `apt-get install <package>` use `apt-get install <package>=<version>`
Dockerfile:10 DL3015 [92minfo[0m: Avoid additional packages by specifying `--no-install-recommends`
Dockerfile:10 DL3059 [92minfo[0m: Multiple consecutive `RUN` instructions. Consider consolidation.
Dockerfile:15 DL3059 [92minfo[0m: Multiple consecutive `RUN` instructions. Consider consolidation.
Dockerfile:18 DL3059 [92minfo[0m: Multiple consecutive `RUN` instructions. Consider consolidation.

QC.Met01.hint: The two formats for software citation supported by SQAaaS are: 1) CodeMeta and 2) Citation File Format (CFF). While CodeMeta provides you with a more comprehensive description, CFF is a more lightweight, good-enough approach to software (with built-in support by GitHub) citation. Both provide tools (CodeMeta generator, CFFINIT)to easily generate a working citation file. Once having the file, be sure to add it to the root path of your code repo.
